Key Match Events: Zach Dezenzo drew a go-ahead bases-loaded walk in the eighth inning.
Houston Astros took advantage of two Kansas City errors in a four-run eighth inning to beat the Royals 6-3.
José Altuve scored from second on a play to tie the score.
Mauricio Dubón hit a single to left field to score Ben Gamel and Jeremy Peña.
Ryan Pressly pitched a scoreless eighth to earn the win after being activated from the 15-day injured list.
Josh Hader pitched a perfect ninth to earn his 29th save of the season.
Kyle Isbel hit a three-run double down the left-field line for the Royals.
Jason Heyward had a two-run double in his Astros debut.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Astros starter Hunter Brown allowed two hits and no earned runs while striking out four and walking one in 6 2/3 innings.
Royals shortstop Bobby Witt Jr. went 0 for 4 after hitting safely in 16 of his previous 17 games.
Astros third baseman Alex Bregman was ejected in the fourth inning after appearing to complain about a strike-three call.
Royals RF Hunter Renfroe started running and doing a full workout on Wednesday.
Astros RF Kyle Tucker has been looking good in drills and sprinting exercises.
